"**As Long as You Love Me** " is a song by [Canadian](/wiki/Canada "Canada")
recording artist [Justin Bieber](/wiki/Justin_Bieber "Justin Bieber"), from
his third [studio album](/wiki/Studio_album "Studio album"),
_[Believe](/wiki/Believe_\(Justin_Bieber_album\) "Believe \(Justin Bieber
album\)")_ (2012). The track features American rapper [Big
Sean](/wiki/Big_Sean "Big Sean"). It was written by both artists with Nasri
Atweh, and was produced by [Rodney "Darkchild" Jerkins](/wiki/Rodney_Jerkins
"Rodney Jerkins") and [Andre Lindal](/wiki/Andre_Lindal "Andre Lindal"). It
was first released on June 11, 2012, as a promotional single from the album,
and one month later it was released as the album's second single.

The song has since charted in the United Kingdom, first at number thirty as a
promotional single with first-week sales of 11,598, and then after being
released as a single it improved its position on the [UK Singles
Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart"), reaching number 22.[3] On
_Billboard_ 's [Rhythmic Airplay Chart](/wiki/Rhythmic_Airplay_Chart "Rhythmic
Airplay Chart"), the single reached number one, giving Bieber his first number
one single on an American airplay music chart.[4] It peaked at number six on
the _Billboard_ Hot 100.

It also reached the number one position on _Billboard_ 's [Dance/Mix Show
Airplay](/wiki/Dance/Mix_Show_Airplay "Dance/Mix Show Airplay") chart, making
Bieber the fifth Canadian artist to reach that position after [Martin
Solveig](/wiki/Martin_Solveig "Martin Solveig") featuring
[Dragonette](/wiki/Dragonette "Dragonette")'s
"[Hello](/wiki/Hello_\(Martin_Solveig_song\) "Hello \(Martin Solveig song\)")"
in 2011.[5] The song has sold 2,240,000 copies in the US as December 2012.[6]
The music video features actor [Michael Madsen](/wiki/Michael_Madsen "Michael
Madsen").

## Background and
release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=As_Long_as_You_Love_Me_\(Justin_Bieber_song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background and release")]

In late 2011, Bieber confirmed to radio network [Capital
FM](/wiki/Capital_\(radio_network\) "Capital \(radio network\)") that he was
recording material for his third studio album, which was originally going to
be released in early 2012.[7] He later spoke to [MTV News](/wiki/MTV_News "MTV
News") and revealed that _Believe_ would surprise people in different ways,
since it musically is a departure from his previous works.[8] While Bieber has
said that he wants his next release to recall [Justin
Timberlake](/wiki/Justin_Timberlake "Justin Timberlake")'s _[Future Sex/Love
Sounds](/wiki/Future_Sex/Love_Sounds "Future Sex/Love Sounds")_ sonically, in
an interview with [V magazine](/wiki/V_\(American_magazine\) "V \(American
magazine\)"), he noted that what he'll be singing is a bit more PG than the
topics Timberlake covered on that album.[9]

> "I'm not going to try to conform to what people want me to be or go out
> there and start partying, have people see me with alcohol. I want to do it
> at my own pace. I don't want to start singing about things like sex, drugs
> and swearing. I'm into love, and maybe I'll get more into making love when
> I'm older. I want to be someone who is respected by everybody."[9]

After releasing "[Boyfriend](/wiki/Boyfriend_\(Justin_Bieber_song\) "Boyfriend
\(Justin Bieber song\)")" as the lead single, Bieber announced that he will
release promotional singles to promote
[_Believe_](/wiki/Believe_\(Justin_Bieber_album\) "Believe \(Justin Bieber
album\)").[10] The first promotional single "Die in Your Arms" was released to
iTunes on May 29, 2012.[11] The second "All Around The World" was released on
[iTunes](/wiki/ITunes "ITunes") on June 4, 2012.[11] "As Long as You Love Me"
was released on June 11, 2012, as the third and final promotional
single.[11][12]

The cover art for "As Long as You Love Me" shows Bieber perched on a wooden
stool, holding an acoustic guitar.[13] Sia Nicole of
"[Idolator](/wiki/Idolator_\(website\) "Idolator \(website\)") expressed
dissatisfaction with the cover, saying "It’s false advertising for the high-
fidelity track that has nary a strum within earshot."[13]

## Composition and
lyrics[[edit](/w/index.php?title=As_Long_as_You_Love_Me_\(Justin_Bieber_song\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Composition and lyrics")]

"As Long as You Love Me" was written by Bieber, Nasri Atweh, and guest
vocalist [Big Sean](/wiki/Big_Sean "Big Sean"), while production was handled
by Darkchild, The Messengers and Andre Lindal.[14][15] The song is officially
written in the key of [C minor](/wiki/C_minor "C minor").[16] It is heavily
influenced by [dubstep](/wiki/Dubstep "Dubstep"),[15] with vocal loops
complemented by a booming beat.[17] As the song continues, it builds and
builds to a rave-ready drop.[18]

Lyrically, it tells listeners that true love can defy all circumstances and
the obstacles that it can overcome.[15][2] "As long as you love me/ We could
be starving/ We could be homeless/ We could be broke," Bieber sings over a
staccato beat and handclaps, with an undercurrent of a swirling-sounding
synth. "As long as you love me/ I'll be your platinum/ I'll be your silver/
I'll be your gold," he adds. Big Sean drops a rap exalting a lady love, too.
"I don't know if this makes sense, but you're my hallelujah/ Give me a time
and a place, and I'll rendezvous, and I'll fly you to it," Sean raps.[17]

## Critical
reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=As_Long_as_You_Love_Me_\(Justin_Bieber_song\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Critical reception")]

Jon Caramanica of _[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times "The New York
Times")_ described the song as "a dubstep love song, with Mr. Bieber reaching
into falsetto at points without losing power, and showing restraint at the
chorus."[2] Natalie Shaw of [BBC Music](/wiki/BBC_Music "BBC Music") wrote,
"It's fine that his vocal simpers on the verses of As Long As You Love Me,
because the song's pulsating undercurrent propels it onto the dancefloor."[19]
Hermione Hoby of _[The Observer](/wiki/The_Observer "The Observer")_
complimented his vocals, calling "plaintive and still unmistakably
teenage."[20] Jason Lipshutz of _[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\)
"Billboard \(magazine\)")_ defined the track: "A massive yet somehow intimate
dance track, with the drums almost reaching hair metal levels in their
vibrations. The Biebs handles his business, but Big Sean's verse probably
isn't necessary."[21]

Becky Bain of Idolator commented, "The electro-infused track carries your
basic we-don’t-need-money-we-have-love sentiment, while Big Sean cameo is
mostly useless, but it does come at a pivotal moment in the Darkchild-produced
tune."[18]

In his review for [Fact Magazine](/wiki/Fact_Magazine_\(United_Kingdom\) "Fact
Magazine \(United Kingdom\)"), Alex Macpherson described the track:

> "'As Long As You Love Me' is a post-austerity, us-against-the-world
> electronic storm in which Bieber promises romantic fealty even as he's
> buffeted this way and that by a cornucopia of sonic switch-ups courtesy of
> Darkchild: the 4×4 march leading up to the peak of the second chorus, the
> way the word 'love' is caught, cut up and tossed into a digital swirl until
> it becomes helpless surrender. Notably and surprisingly, too, Bieber's own
> delivery stands out: his blend of puppy-eyed pleading and genuine tenderness
> on the line 'We could be homeless, we could be broke' is the song's
> emotional pivot. It's enough to make you jealous of those terrifyingly
> devoted Beliebers: imagine how much more intensely they’re feeling
> this."[22]

## Music
video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=As_Long_as_You_Love_Me_\(Justin_Bieber_song\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Music video")]

As part of promotion for "As Long As You Love Me", a music video, which was
filmed in early July 2012, was released. Prior to the release of the video,
Bieber revealed that a minute-long clip of the video was due to be broadcast
following an episode of _[The Voice](/wiki/The_Voice_\(U.S._TV_series\) "The
Voice \(U.S. TV series\)")_ ; however, much to the displeasure of Bieber and
his fans, the clip wasn't shown. [NBC](/wiki/NBC "NBC") later revealed that
technical difficulties prevented the clip from being aired. The full video was
later premiered on Bieber's official YouTube page on July 12, 2012. Bieber
very rarely referred to the video as a "music video", but rather as a "short
film". Directed by [Anthony Mandler](/wiki/Anthony_Mandler "Anthony Mandler"),
produced by Andrew Lerios, cinematography by David Devlin, and edited by
Jacquelyn London[23][24] the video was Bieber's longest music video at five
minutes and fifty-two seconds, before being surpassed by "Confident" at six
minutes and six seconds. It featured guest appearances by [Michael
Madsen](/wiki/Michael_Madsen "Michael Madsen") and [Big Sean](/wiki/Big_Sean
"Big Sean"), the latter of which performs the rapping on the track. The video
was filmed in [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles"),
[California](/wiki/California "California"). The actress in the music video is
Chanel Celaya.

## Live
performances[[edit](/w/index.php?title=As_Long_as_You_Love_Me_\(Justin_Bieber_song\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Live performances")]

Bieber performed the song for the first time in [Oslo](/wiki/Oslo "Oslo"),
[Norway](/wiki/Norway "Norway") at the [Oslo Opera
House](/wiki/Oslo_Opera_House "Oslo Opera House"), on May 30, 2012 at his
_Believe[promo](/wiki/Promotion_\(marketing\) "Promotion \(marketing\)")
tour_.[25] Also Bieber performed the song, with Big Sean, in [Today
Show](/wiki/Today_\(U.S._TV_program\) "Today \(U.S. TV program\)") on June 15,
2012 and again with Big Sean at the [2012 Teen Choice
Awards](/wiki/2012_Teen_Choice_Awards "2012 Teen Choice Awards"), in a medley
with "[Boyfriend](/wiki/Boyfriend_\(Justin_Bieber_song\) "Boyfriend \(Justin
Bieber song\)")".[26] Bieber also performed the song, once again with Big
Sean, during the season finale of the [NBC](/wiki/NBC "NBC") summer reality
talent show "[America's Got Talent](/wiki/America%27s_Got_Talent "America's
Got Talent")". He also performed in late September on "[Dancing With The
Stars](/wiki/Dancing_With_The_Stars "Dancing With The Stars")", and on the
February 9, 2013 episode of "[Saturday Night Live](/wiki/Saturday_Night_Live
"Saturday Night Live")", which he also hosted. Bieber has also performed the
song on the 2012 Victoria's Secret Fashion show on November 7, 2012 in a
medley with "[Boyfriend](/wiki/Boyfriend_\(Justin_Bieber_song\) "Boyfriend
\(Justin Bieber song\)")". On March 28, 2015, Bieber performed a duet with
[Ariana Grande](/wiki/Ariana_Grande "Ariana Grande") on [The Honeymoon
Tour](/wiki/The_Honeymoon_Tour "The Honeymoon Tour") in [Miami](/wiki/Miami
"Miami"). Bieber performed the song at the [2015 Wango
Tango](/wiki/Wango_Tango#Main_Stage_6 "Wango Tango").
